a period of time between two points of time or events; interval.
= ಎಡೆದಱಪು.
to be or get opened in between (not at the either ends).
= ಎಡೆತೊಱೆ.
a conveying of information between two persons in a distorted manner as to get advantage for oneself; a making of false or defamatory statement.
a speech or casual remark interrupting conversation, discussion between or among others.
(space, room, extent) to be sufficient; to be able to envelop.
the fact or an instance of the space, room being sufficient (to hold, contain or envelop).
to seek for an appropriate moment, opportunity or occasion.
to get some space, room or shelter.
to have a favourable occasion or opportunity.
the period in one's life between youth and old age (usu. from about 40 to about 65 years).
to serve food; to offer or set food before a person.
(prob. ಎದೆಬಾವು) a tumour, swelling (in the thorax ?).
to leave room in between; to give an interval; to stop (the process, chain of events) for a brief period; to interrupt the flow; (usu. eḍe biḍade = without a gap; without a break; incessantly).
the intermediate ordinary quality.
to slow down the process; to consume more time; to slacken the speed.
to keep from being seen; to place out of sight; to conceal.
a small wooden plank, usu. of rectangular shape, for keeping the dining plate or leaf on.
a house in between two houses.
the central room or hall situated at the centre of a house.
to serve food; to offer or set food before a person.
to make a room for; to allow something happen in between two events; to do so by interrupting the flow of a process.
to give an opportunity.
to offer food (to a god or a religious man).
a speech or casual remark interrupting conversation, discussion between or among others.
to change oneself from one place or position to another; to displace oneself.
a change in one's place or position.
(dial.) a congested place; a relatively narrower, smaller room than required.
to turn back (before reaching the destination or goal); to deviate towards opposite direction.
(fig.) an obstacle or impediment on one's way.
to be interrupted; one's scheme, thought process, etc. to be hindered or broken.
(gram. a heterogenous compound) the untimely death of a person; unexpected end of one's life.
that cannot happen or is not possible; impossible.
a man who is close by or living near (one's place).
one who tends cattle; a cowherd.
the herdsman caste.
(rhet.) a kind of metre having four syllabic feet having Brahma, Viṣṇu and Rudra gaṇas.
being or occurring at the middle place; intermediate.
to move to and fro, without going to the extreme or far ends; to move in or around the central area.
to know, understand suitable place, opportunity or occasion.
a moving around; the act or an instance of roaming.
he who moves here and there or around.
= ಎಡೆಯಾಟ.
to cause to roam about.
to go from place to place; to roam; to stroll.
= ಎಡೆಯಾಟ.
the tendency or habit of a person moving from one place to another.
(the place) to become dry.
to leave room in between.
to give an interval of time or space between two events.
to interrupt a continuous process for a brief period.
to offer food to a deity, a mendicant, etc.
to give or provide place or room.
to provide a helping or favourable occasion or opportunity.
to give way; to submit oneself; to yield.
to be broken; (continuity of an action, process order etc.) to be interrupted, disrupted.
to push, project, protrude in between or across.
